text: The vast infinity of space -
Soon the silhouette of a PLANET fills the screen - The sun breaks slowly across the arc of the planet -
As the light increases we see the planet is EARTH -  A TITLE reads "EARTH - 2070 A.D." Soon afterward the moon can be seen in the distance -

Ahh, the space age.  Must have been a thrilling time to be alive.  All  the hopes for a better tomorrow, all  the dreams of inhabiting new worlds... Soon a SPACESHIP enters the frame - only the rear of the as it heads into space -

It's amazing they even made it out this far, considering what they had to work with.  Guess it really was one giant leap...a hundred years ago. Soon the side of the ship becomes more and more visible -
But I guess after that first leap,  things just weren't as exciting.   How much do you need to know about a place like the moon? It's cold, silent... The camera begins to PAN the side of the ship -

But it sure was a beautiful place to visit, or so they said.  At least if  you could afford it...guess it all  boils down to money in the long run - As the camera PANS across the side of the ship, we see it written in a slick, commercial  style -
Me, I just felt lucky to be along  for the ride.

We see DAWN MURPHY, an attractive girl in her late 20's g the lounge -  Just then MAC, a fully articulated human android, dressed concierge-like outfit, approaches Dawn - She turns to face him, and his eye scans a small, compute he looks up to her -
How are you this evening, Dawn Murphy? Dawn smiles at the android, looks around as if a little e back out the window -
I'm fine.
Congratulations on your...recent award.
Thank you.
Is there anything I can help you with?
No, just enjoying the view.
Well, there's no better to way  to see the world, than with us.
So I've been told.

Well if you need anything, please feel free to ask me.  Just a  reminder we have fabulous cuisine available 24 hours in the earthrise room, and a large selection of vintage wines here in our ship bar. Dawn then looks at Mac -
Thank you, I'm fine. Mac smiles at Dawn -

Enjoy your trip with us. Mac then heads off - Dawn turns and looks at him -  We see the lounge of the ship - sleek and luxurious, deco material - behind the bar we see the bartender JACK, a bu cleaning some glasses - Mac walks by a table where a couple is sitting - they are overweight man with slicked back hair and a gaudy ring on him is MONICA MILES, 22, a buxom, somewhat bored-looking enormous diamond WEDDING RING - Delbert puts down his drink and grabs Mac as he passes -
Hey, chief... Mac stops and looks at the couple, scanning the pins on t
Hello, Delbert and Monica Miles. Congratulations on your recent wedding -
Yeah yeah look never mind all that, (shakes his drink)
let me get another one of these, lots of ice, and don't be stingy with  the whiskey this time ok? Jack listens in the background to the conversation -  Mac then looks at Monica -
Certainly, and anything for you Monica?
I'm fine, thank you.
Oh, and bring out some more of  those little baked things and some hot mustard.
Certainly.  I will now process your request, and I hope you're enjoying your trip with us. Mac walks away - Monica stares into her drink -
I don't like him calling me by my name, it gives me the creeps.
Yeah, I wish he'd put a sock in  it already. Delbert downs the remainder of his drink - Monica looks s Delbert notices this, puts his drink down -
What's wrong baby?  You haven't  said a whole lot lately... Delbert picks up her hand and kisses it - Monica doesn't
I'm homesick.
Homesick?  It's only been two days!
We should have gone to Nassau. At least we could go swimming, lie on the beach.
Ah hell we can always do that. Listen believe me, once we get to the  moon, your tone is going to change.
How is it going to be different from this?  Go see some boring footprint under glass?
Look you were the one who wanted to do something different, something to tell all your friends.  Any chump can go to Nassau.   Delbert scans the room, littered with the beautiful peopl
Look around you baby, we're rubbing elbows with royalty, oil sheiks, this is class.  You'll be envied by everyone.
I guess so.
Besides I can't wait to tee off on the sea of tranquillity. That should shore up that prick Hank Drexler. Monica stares blankly back at him -
You know?  The guy at the club I was telling you about? Monica takes a sip of her drink, and puts it down -
I still say we should have gone to Nassau.
PAN an array of blinking controls and sensors - seated at first mate, RYAN TAYLOR, a good-looking man in his 30's, Soon the ship's captain approaches, CAPTAIN REYNOLDS, a d in his fifties -
How's everything looking?

Finishing up the diagnostic, everything checks out normal, we still have to take a look at the starboard suite on B  deck.  We've relocated her and she doesn't seem to be that upset about it. Seated across the bridge, second mate ALEX BARNES turns a
Why should she, it's her fault.   All guests are told not to eat  in zero gravity, but she just  wanted to have fun I guess,  didn't realize what a grain of  salt can do to sophisticated machinery.
Well, I guess she figures she's paying for it.
Ain't it the truth. Must be good to be rich. Reynolds takes a look at his watch -
All right, I'm headed down to  engineering.  If you gentlemen need me, that's where I'll be.
Yes sir. Reynolds leaves the room -  Barnes then gets up and stretches -
Well I guess there's no time like the present.  I'll go  run a check on that room, just  to show we go that extra mile for our guests.
Sounds like you've been talking to Mac too much. Barnes heads toward the door -
Yeah.  I think he's developing a crush on me. Taylor smiles as Barnes exits - he then turns his attenti POV he cursors down to a command - "LIFE POD STATUS: ENGA We see him select that option -
Two PORTERS struggle with the luggage of ANNA KOROS, the shipping fortune, who follows behind -
Now look will you please be careful with those!  They cost  more than you make in a year. The two porters look at each other as one unlocks the doo Anna takes a CELLULAR phone out of her purse -
When will my original room be ready again?
I'm sure they'll notify you as soon as they're done ma'am.
Shuffling back and forth!  I feel like I'm traveling coach! She dials the phone from the hallway watching the two men

Put them near the window! And be careful! Anna dials the phone and puts it to her ear - she then do hall -  POV We see an impeccably groomed, movie star handsome WAR neighboring suite room and lock the door -  Anna's jaw drops as she slowly lowers the phone -  Wayne puts his key in his pocket and gracefully slicks hi perfectly combed hair before heading in the direction of
Anna watches him approach -
(to herself)
Oh my God... Wayne approaches and smiles at Anna -
Evening.
It can't be.
Excuse me?
You're Warren Wayne. Warren slows down, somewhat reluctantly -
Uh, yes I am.  And you are?
Anna Koros. She sensually extends her hand, Warren shakes it -
Koros, as in...Koros?  Dimitri Koros?
My grandfather.  My God, I can't tell you what a fan I am of yours! You were magnificent in Deadly  Gamble.
Oh, thank you.
Magnificent, magnificent.
Well I appreciate that.
So, what brings you out here? (Beat)
Pleasure cruise?

Well a little business too.  In my upcoming project Star Trackers I  play a ship's captain, and I really wanted to get a feel for the outer space experience.  I feel it will add more credibility to my performance.
Of course, of course...
So...
Well I guess we're neighbors for this trip.
Well, so we are. (Beat, gestures towards window)
Sure is beautiful, huh?
(looking at Wayne)
It certainly is. Wayne looks at Anna and smiles -
Well, it was nice meeting you. Enjoy the rest of the trip.
I'm sure I will. Wayne heads off -
I'm sure we'll see each other again. Wayne turns back and smiles -  As he turns away we see his smile vanish -  Just then the two porters exit the room -
You're all set ma'am.  I'll personally go and check on the  status of the old room right now.
You'll do nothing of the kind. The two porters look at her as she heads toward the door
I'm staying put, thank you very much. Anna then slams the door in the porter's face - the two m

Camera approaches Barnes as he works on some circuitry in Quickly and methodically, Barnes works with some TOOLS - the length of the hallway before quickly taking a small M pocket -  CLOSE on the case as he opens it - it contains a sophisti attached to a dense white CUBE of what appears to be plas by black metal -

Taylor continues running a check of the life pods onscree Just then a command comes up - "FAIL MODE CONFIRMED: 96%" The command seems to trouble Taylor, who faces the comput commands - he pauses for a beat -  He sits back - once again, "FAIL MODE CONFIRMED:  96%" Taylor frowns at the command - he presses a button on his
Barnes begins to carefully cross-install the device in th in the circuit panel - soon his watch beeps -
Hey Barnes. Barnes stops working for a beat, then answers his watch -
Yeah go.
Taylor looks at the monitor -
I'm getting a very strange command on the life pod status check. Did anything come up on the last diagnostic?
Barnes seems angry at the news - he shakes his head, bite removes the few wires he has attached -
No, I just ran it!  Why are you running it again?
Well it's a good thing that I  did.
Taylor looks at the screen -
It's telling me fail mode confirmed.  Did you see this?
There must be some mistake. You sure you hit the right commands?
Yes I'm sure I hit the right commands.
Why don't you reset and run it again.  The pods check out ok.
You're certain of that?
Trust me. (Beat)
Even checked 'em with my own  eyes.
All right, I'll give it a shot. Taylor presses the button on his watch and resets the com Just then Dawn Taylor enters the bridge - Taylor turns an The two look at each other for a beat -
They said it would be ok to come up here. Taylor gets up and approaches - Dawn extends her hand -
I'm Dawn Murphy. They shake hands -
Oh right, right you're on that research grant.
That's right.
Ryan Taylor, first mate.  Welcome aboard.  First time in space?
Yes.  Theoretical discoveries aside, there's nothing like the real thing. How about you?
This is my second commercial flight. (Beat)
I used to run satellite freighters but that got old fast.  Dawn looks around the bridge -
So you were looking for a new challenge.
Well, plus the money ain't that bad.
So, tell me, do you think everyone gets their million dollars' worth on this trip of a lifetime? Taylor and Dawn look at each other and smile -
Well, let me put it this way.  Most of the cost is due to safety reasons. Most people are not familiar with space travel, so we have to take extra precautions in the event they do something careless.
Like open an airlock by mistake?
Well I don't think there's a  chance of that happening.  It's usually the moon walks.  Sometimes you feel like a kindergarten teacher.
(laughs)
Well I hope I don't do anything careless.
I'm sure you'll be all right.
Actually I've logged about 200 hours of simulated space walking at the institute, mostly related to starship construction.
Really?
Still, I hope I behave on the  moon. (Beat)
I'll stick close to you.
Well then you'll have nothing to worry about at all.   (Beat)
You're dealing with a trained professional. I guess. Dawn and Taylor smile at one another -
CLOSE on the table where Delbert and Monica were sitting balled-up NAPKINS, PEANUT SHELLS, CRUMBS, TOOTHPICKS, SME
Carlo looks at the table with disgust, and shakes his hea Jack approaches Carlo in the now desolate lounge - Carlo folds up the entire tablecloth -
Look at this...Jesus.
Yeah, I guess money don't buy class.
No.  But it buys a lot of other things.
Like that piece of ass he was with.
Well...I don't mind.  I can put up with it.  I'm taking six months off after this, and I won't have to deal with people snapping their  fingers at me.
Not me.  I'm in for the long haul. In nine months I'll have enough to  take a few years off.
Well, more power to you.  Me, I start to bug out after too much time out here.
I don't have a problem with it.   Besides, you get to meet a lot of interesting people. Carlo holds up the tablecloth -
Yeah.  A virtual pantheon of stars. Carlo walks off - Jack watches him -
Hey, it's early yet.

Various groups of well dressed individuals sit amongst va dining room -  At one table Capt. Reynolds sits with Dawn and some other Delbert Miles shoves a forkful of food in his mouth -  Just then CARLO, a mild - mannered waiter in his 30's, ap behind -
More wine sir?
Yeah.   Carlo begins to carefully pour a glassful - Delbert takes hand and proceeds to fill the glass to the brim -
Just leave the bottle. Carlo watches for a beat - Delbert puts the bottle down a
Don't worry I'll take care of  you at the end of the night. Next to Delbert, Monica picks at her food - next to her, peripherally ogles her cleavage -
Oh no...I think there's carrots in here...
Send it back if you don't want it. Delbert looks at Carlo -
She's allergic to carrots.  Is there carrots in that?
Uh, I don't believe so, no, but I can -
Yeah go check it out.  I don't need her turning purple on me, though it would match her dress. (chuckles)
Go to hell. Carlo nods, and walks away -
(laughs)
I'm just kidding baby. Across the table Warren Wayne smiles as he listens to the the corner of his mouth with his napkin -  Just then Anna appears from out of nowhere and props up a
So... Wayne looks at her as she looks him directly in the eye, drinks -
What was it like doing a love scene with Pamela Jarvis? The others listen to the conversation -
Well, uh, I just don't know what to say... (Beat, nervous laugh)
I guess there's worse ways to  make a living.
I did a love scene once for an interactive instructional disc. The guy had B.O. and I told him so.  Next day he wore so much cologne I almost threw up.
Oh.  Really?
Why don't you tell them the good  side? Monica looks at Delbert, then at the others -
That's where I met Delbert.  He came down to the set, then he wanted me on more discs, then he put me in the magazine. (giggles)
Then he married me!
Well, see?  It wasn't so bad after all.
I bet Pamela had nothing bad to say  about you.
No, I think hygiene is important. It helps you get into the part.
Very professional of you. Dawn sits and talks to Captain Reynolds - the conversatio din - just then Reynolds checks his watch and says "excus up -
Excuse me ladies and gentlemen, can I have your attention please? The people at the table turn and face Reynolds - the din
Could I have your attention  please? The voices die down in the room -

On behalf of myself and the crew, I'd like to welcome you all aboard the Star Princess.  I guarantee this will be a trip you will  never forget. The others look at Reynolds - Delbert downs another drink

In approximately 36 hours we will be landing 300 yards from the very spot where the Apollo 12 lunar module first set down in 1969.   From there you will be able to  leave the ship and be an eyewitness to history.  The actual flag, the actual first footprint, all carefully preserved for you to view. It's going to be a tremendous experience, and I'm glad all of you decided to come along for the ride. Reynolds smiles at the crowd and gestures to Mac -

Now many passengers want to know the nuts and bolts of how we carry out the operation.  So for all you technology fans I'm happy to  announce we have Mac on board.   Mac is our mobile automated concierge,  and has been programmed to have an  encyclopedic knowledge of every detail  of the ship's operations.  He's here  to make you happy, so feel free to  ask him anything. Mac smiles at the guests -

So once again, thanks for coming aboard, and enjoy your stay on the star princess. The sound of "here here" and clinking glasses is heard as out the room -  Just then Delbert nuzzles up to Monica and paws her -
(slurring)
I'm horny. Monica shoves his hands away -
Get your hands off of me!
The ship continues it's way toward the moon in the  distance -
Barnes and Taylor sit at their respective consoles -
Well, everything's running smoother than a baby's ass.
Ain't it the truth. The two say nothing for a beat -  Taylor leans back in his chair, yawns, and stretches -
So, are you on for the next one?
I don't know.  Everything's up in the air at this point, no pun intended.
Why, didn't they say?
Well that hotel begins construction in January, there's going to be a lot of shuttle work.
You want to go back to shuttle work?
It's steady, good benefits. Barnes looks at Taylor -
You gotta think of your old age.
That's very pragmatic of you, Barnes.
Thank you. Taylor gets up -
Man, I'm hungry.  I'm going to call the steward, you want anything?.
Nah, I already ate. (Beat)
Why don't you just go down there?
What, and leave you here all by your lonesome?
Uh... Barnes gestures to the consoles -
I think I can handle it.
Well, maybe I will. (Beat)
You sure you don't want anything?
No.  I'm all set.  Thanks.
Well, maybe I'll surprise you.
I can hardly wait. Barnes watches Taylor as he exits -  The door closes - just then Barnes turns around and crouc
CLOSE on Barnes opening a PANEL and carefully sliding out
The door opens and Taylor walks in - he surveys the room Dawn approaches the bar - Taylor sees her -  Just then Mac approaches Taylor -
Officer Taylor, how are you this evening?
Mac.  What's shaking?
(Beat)
I don't understand. Taylor heads to the bar -
You are currently stationed for bridge duty at this time. Taylor looks at Mac -
Yes Mac I know that.   Taylor walks away -
Jeez...hall monitor. Mac watches him leave, then heads over to another passeng

Barnes works feverishly on the computer keyboard -  A SCREEN appears, reading CREW LOCATION -  There is a list of crew members, starting with the captai A diagram of the ship appears - Barnes highlights the cap indicates the captain is located in his room -  Barnes smiles -
Nighty night, captain. Barnes then highlights Taylor's name - the diagram indica area -
Have one on the house for me.
CLOSE on the PIN on Reynolds' jacket, hanging from a

Reynolds walks over to a chair dressed in his bathrobe - chair and takes a book off the  table -  He then feels his head for a second, then puts the book d uniform - he feels the pockets, shakes his head -  He looks around the room, and exits his quarters -
CLOSE on a pair of READING GLASSES folded and lying on a background Barnes continues to work -  As we get closer top Barnes we see small beads of sweat o
Well...I suppose you can't have your cake... A screen then appears before Barnes - it reads:
Barnes pauses for a beat -

...without breaking a few eggs. Barnes then hits "enter" - a 60 second COUNTDOWN  begins 59...58...57... Barnes sits back -  Suddenly the bridge door SLIDES OPEN -  Barnes SPINS his chair around -  Reynolds enters the bridge in his bathrobe, brandishing h
Why was this door locked? Barnes stands up and stares at Reynolds -
Isn't it past your bed time, sir? Reynolds approaches Barnes -
What did you say to me?
It's a little late for you to  be up.
Look answer my question! Just then Reynolds spots the hybrid computer linked to th
What's going on here! Reynolds storms over to the monitor -
What the hell is that? Barnes approaches from behind -
That's mine.  I was just having  a little fun. Reynolds turns and looks incredulously at Barnes -
A little fun?  Have you lost it Barnes!  You realize how sensitive  this equipment is? Barnes nods, and stares down Reynolds -
All too well, captain.
Well shut it off at once! Reynolds turns and looks at the computer as it counts dow
What's the meaning of this  countdown? CLOSE on a SILENCED GUN appearing in Barnes' hand -
I can't tell you that... CLOSE on Reynolds staring at the computer - Barnes approa

...it's not on the agenda. Just as Reynolds begins to turn around - BLAM! a bullet R Reynolds stares at Barnes for a beat, then staggers back console -  BLAM! another blast - soon Reynolds hits the ground falli approaches him and BLAM! shoots again - CLOSE on the COMPUTER - 15...14...13...12... Barnes then aims at Reynolds' head offscreen - BLAM!  Blo wall - CLOSE on Barnes face as he looks in the direction of the CLOSE on the computer: 5...4...3...2...1... CLOSE on Barnes -
Blastoff.
Suddenly -  BOOOMMMM!!  A blinding flash fills the corridor -
An explosion RIPS through the outside of the ship - huge heat of the fireball -
Terrified passengers grab on to handrails for dear life a space -
The room shudders violently - people scream as bottles fl breaks, lights flicker -  Terrified passengers run toward the exit -
Suddenly a CHAIN reaction of explosions send a series of space -
The drop in pressure sends debris hurling around the room passengers -
An EXPLOSION sends ovens, overhead fixtures and boiling c killing the cooks, all screaming in vain -
Taylor fights to get his bearings - he runs to the dining rapidly -
Several ENGINEERS scramble to get out as an EXPLOSION rip A burst PIPE spews toxic gas into the room - the engineer clawing at the doors -
A few scattered explosions occur around the now severely drifts erratically through the void -
Moaning and groaning can be heard throughout the darkened Taylor looks around, surveying the damage -  He sees Dawn hunched in the corner, coughing - he rushes
Are you all right? Dawn looks up at Taylor -
(shaken)
I don't know.  I guess so. Taylor addresses his wrist communicator -
Bridge? (Beat)
Captain?! (Beat)
Hello Bridge!                 Taylor taps the device - he then rushes over to the INTER with his fist -
Bridge! (Beat)
Bridge, do you copy!
Barnes scans a DIAGRAM of the ship on the screen, noting functioning -
Bridge!  Can anyone hear me?!
Yeah yeah yeah, give me a minute here. Barnes looks at the diagram and smiles faintly -
A little sloppy.  But it will do.
Taylor speaks into the intercom -
If anyone can hear me please respond!
That's very professional sounding of you, Taylor. Taylor looks around the room -
CLOSE on a small MONITOR with a wide view of the dining  room -  Barnes speaks into a small MICROPHONE on the console -
We hope you're enjoying your trip.   And we apologize to those currently hurtling through space.  Guess them's the breaks.
Carlo looks around the smoky room apprehensively, then lo Taylor looks at Carlo -  Dawn looks at Taylor, who speaks into the intercom -
Barnes, can you hear me, are you all right?
Why yes Ryan, I am, and thanks for asking.  You don't have to talk to the intercom, I can hear you fine.
What is the condition of the bridge?
The bridge is fine, Taylor, how  are things down there?
Transmit the code 3 emergency and take us offline.  Override the airlock sensors and hurry!  We're running out of time, we have to get  to the pods!
Much as I'd like to help you and  our valued guests, I'm afraid I can't.
What are you talking about!   Can you transmit the code 3 -
Yes I can transmit the code 3 emergency!   (Beat)
I just don't think it's a prudent move at this juncture. Dawn approaches Taylor with a worried look on her face -
What's he talking about? Taylor looks at Dawn, then back toward the room -
Barnes have you flipped your wig?
Barnes gets closer to the mike to be emphatic -
It's a weave, Taylor, and you  know that.  We've always been  straight with one another.
Now do you want the good news first or the bad news?
You better start making sense!
Ok, I will.  The bad news is the  ship is history.  Life support will last another 36 hours, maybe.
Then we've got to get to the  lifepods!
I'd advise you to shut up and let me finish Taylor.  You  needn't worry about the lifepods because they're all gone,  jettisoned. Save for one.
The people in the room react to this news -
And I think we know who's getting it.
Why are you doing this!
I was getting to that.  Now please don't try my patience Ryan.
Now we're all businessmen and a common rule of business is to make payment for services rendered. Given that, I'm willing to provide a service to each and every one of you.
I'm willing to transmit that code 3 emergency. If you're lucky a rescue team might just get to you in time. Of course by then I'll be long gone.
In exchange for what!
Well Carlo, you're not really part of the equation...

But those other high rollers around you are.  I will provide this service in return for the personal  authorization codes of each and every  bank account.  Once I have those codes, and I've completed the  transfer, I'll signal the alarm.  But not a minute before.
Taylor listens to this as Delbert approaches -
What the hell is he talking about?
What part didn't you understand, fat  man?  It's a hold up, pure and simple.   I want your money.  Cooperate and I'll let you live.  And this offer is non- negotiable.  Dawn walks over to Taylor -
It doesn't make any sense.
(to Barnes)
It's suicide Barnes!  How do you think you're going to get away it!
They'll track him down in a heartbeat.

I understand your concern, but those are my problems, not yours. But for the record, the transfer  trail will take them years to follow.   By then it won't matter, because I  won't exist, at least not on paper.
Why would we give you anything without a guarantee of our safety!
Well, I guess that's just a  question of faith, huh?  Of course, if money means more to you than a chance at survival... I'd say you're my kind of guy!
It's still not going to work!   They'll detect you upon re-entry in an emergency vessel!
Who said I'll re-enter in the pod? I got friends out in space, Ryan, friends willing to get me back unnoticed.  Thank God for deregulation huh?
Now I think I've given you all the information you need to make  a sound decision.  But I'd advise you to hurry. Barnes leans closer to the microphone -

I'll give you fifteen minutes to organize your information.  I'll take any further delay as a sign you've rejected the offer, and then of course, it's rescinded. Barnes then reaches over to a button -
Over and out. Barnes then presses the button -
They guests all look at one another - Taylor concentrates Warren approaches him -
This is insane.  This can't be happening. Dawn approaches Taylor -
What are we going to do?
I don't know.
CLOSE on the screen showing the dining room -
I think we should do what he tells us. Barnes leans back and watches them, smiling -
Dawn approaches Taylor, who inspects the sealed door -
How do we know he's not  bluffing? Taylor sees any attempt at opening the door is futile -
We don't.
Well maybe there's a way out of here.
Fat chance of that.  Even if we had C4 and a laser torch these  doors wouldn't budge. (Beat)
That son of a bitch...that stupid son of a bitch.
Carlo and Dawn talk with Taylor -
Given a malfunction, how would a rescue team get you out if the doors won't open?
Probably come through the wall I suppose.
Well maybe we can do something like that. Taylor looks at Dawn -
I don't think you know what you're talking about.  Besides, what could  we use for tools?  A steak knife?  A corkscrew?
Just considering our options... sir. Dawn and Taylor look at each other -
We couldn't try anything anyhow. He must be watching everything we do.
You're right. Taylor looks at the CONTROL PANEL next to the door -
If only I could override this thing. At the other end of the room Mac approaches Delbert who n cigarette -
On the behalf of the Star Princess we apologize for any inconvenience you might experience -
Get outta here, will ya!!
Mac backs off and walks away - Monica approaches Delbert
Well now what are we gonna do!
How am I supposed to know?
You're Delbert Miles!  You have more clout than some whacked out pilot!  Talk to him!
Talk to him...Jesus... Nearby, Jack places a TABLECLOTH over a dead guest -
I tell you one thing, I'm not giving him shit, not a password, not an access code, not the time  of day. Jack turns around and looks at Delbert -  Warren and Anna approach Delbert and Monica -
I think we should do what he  asks. Delbert looks at her incredulously -
Oh you do, huh?  Well let me tell you something lady, if you think that cracker is on the level, you're nuts.
That's a risk we can't afford to take.
I can.  Use your head, do you  think he wants anyone around to say what happened? Jack approaches -
There's a chance he'll keep his end of the bargain, if we only cooperate.
Bullshit. Jack steps up and looks at Delbert -
Look.  We're talking about life and death here.  I don't know why we're even having this  conversation.
Well what would you know about it? You don't have anything to lose. Jack gets closer to Delbert -
You're gonna give him those bank codes, you know why?  Because I'm telling you to, that's why.  I'm not losing my life over some greedy pig.
Who are you calling a pig, rummy? Just then Jack SHOVES Delbert violently - Delbert CHARGES briefly before being separated by Warren -
Come on!  Stop it!  Stop it! Delbert and Jack back off from one another, still staring
Let's just stay calm, ok?
I don't believe this crap! Mac approaches Taylor, Dawn, and Carlo -
I am receiving a high level of negative feedback from our guest's comments.  Many expletives at a higher than usual decibel level. Taylor looks at Mac, then approaches the others -

Look, people, listen to me.  As the first mate, I know a lot about this ship.  Now I don't know what's going on outside these doors, I don't know where the captain is, I don't know who's left out here.  What I do know is that if what he's saying is true, we're in serious trouble.  So I  suggest we collect the information he wants, and give it to him.
That's still no guarantee of anything!
We don't have a choice!  Now let's write them down, OK?
Supposing we could get out of this room?  Is there anything we could do to reach the bridge?
It depends on the condition of  the ship.  If I could get to  one of the suit compartments I could check the exterior air locks for a possible entry.
Can't we access the mainframe to check the ship's condition?
With what?  How am I going to  interface with it?  I need to be able to talk to the system and to have the system talk to me. Dawn looks at Taylor, who looks down at the ground -
We're screwed.  Totally screwed. Suddenly something dawns on Taylor -
A way to talk to the system... Taylor then looks up at Mac - Dawn watches Taylor -  Taylor turns to Carlo -

And so we were saved.  The freighter found Mac floating through the  void, quite by accident, and through this simple twist of fate two  little people made it off the moon. The ship lifts off, and leaves the moon -  The twisted wreckage of the Star Princess can be seen in ship ascends -
Later we would find out the lifepod made it safely back to earth, where the adventures  of Anna Koros and Warren Wayne became the tabloid story of the year. The ship turns and heads away -
